title: 103_s1144
content: The National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988 is amended to include a new paragraph requiring the Director to request funding for specific initiatives in department budgets that align with the President's priorities for the National Drug Control Strategy. Section 1003 of the National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988 is amended to allow the Director to request department personnel for temporary detail to implement the National Drug Control Strategy. The Director has the authority to transfer funds between National Drug Control Program agency accounts, with a limit of 2 percent of the amount appropriated to either account, after approval from the Committee on Appropriations. Additionally, the Director can issue funds control notices to ensure compliance with the National Drug Control Program. The Director can issue funds control notices directing the obligation of appropriated funds for specific time periods and activities. Officers or employees must comply with these notices, and violations may result in disciplinary action. Additionally, there is a limit of 10 political appointees for the National Drug Control Program agency. The Office of National Drug Control Policy limits political appointees to 10% of its staff, with restrictions on certain positions. Federal officers in the agency appointed by the President cannot use their authority for partisan political purposes. SEC. 3. SPECIAL FORFEITURE FUND AMENDMENTS. Establishment of Fund under the Asset Forfeiture Amendments Act of 1988 amended to include transfers from other funds by the Attorney General in specified fiscal years. The Attorney General transfers excess unobligated balance to the Fund quarterly, with adjustments made at the end of the fiscal year to match the actual balance. Transfers are limited to $150,000,000 per fiscal year. The Secretary of the Treasury estimates and transfers excess unobligated balances to the Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund on a quarterly basis, limited to $150,000,000 per fiscal year. The Secretary of the Treasury adjusts transfers to the Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund at the end of each fiscal year to match the actual remaining balance. Transfers are limited to $150,000,000 per fiscal year. The new subsection (c) allows the Director to transfer up to $20,000,000 from the Fund for drug control activities with approval from Congress. Amendments are made to the Department of Justice Assets Forfeiture Fund. The Attorney General is authorized to transfer funds from the Fund to the Office of National Drug Control Policy's Special Forfeiture Fund. The Department of the Treasury is also directed to make transfers from the Fund to the Special Forfeiture Fund. The Attorney General can transfer funds from the Fund to the Office of National Drug Control Policy's Special Forfeiture Fund, as directed by 6073(b)(2) of the Asset Forfeiture Amendments Act of 1988. SEC. 4. COORDINATION WITH EXECUTIVE BRANCH AGENCIES. Section 1004 of the National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988 is amended to require Federal Government program managers to provide information for drug control purposes as requested by the Director. National Drug Control Data Collection Systems may be designated for each agency involved in the program. The Director of the National Drug Control Program agency can designate essential data collection systems for drug control purposes and require modifications to ensure appropriate data coverage. Additionally, officers or employees cannot implement changes in drug control policy without certification from the Director. The National Narcotics Leadership Act of 1988 is amended to terminate the Office of National Drug Control Policy on September 30, 1998. The Director of National Drug Control Policy will now be a member of the President's Cabinet, and the authorization of appropriations is increased from 4 to 9.
